summary:
Graduate of METU Petroleum and Natural Gas Engineering department as an ABET accredited faculty member, awarded among Worldwide Top 80 University by Times Higher Education 2014 World Reputation Rankings survey, and ranked 11th Worldwide from QS World University Rankings on Petroleum Engineering in 2021. 

Experienced and knowledgeable in petroleum, natural gas, underground storage and geothermal on operations, design, and planning in various aspects. Competencies include well intervention, reservoir formation evaluation, data acquisition and characterization, cased & open hole interpretations, dynamic producing conditions, P&A procedures, workover procedures, recompletion, nodal analysis, artificial lift equipment, surface – subsurface systems, well control, remedial cementing evaluation, and related expertise. 

During the time employed by the Schlumberger service company in Europe GeoMarket, engaged with; service delivery & design of wireline and slickline operations, equipment resource planning, operations engineering design, competency training of personnel, field deployment of latest technologies, equipment maintenance tracking, quality assurance & control of data deliverables, job tracking within internal company FMEA / FMECA frameworks, on both offshore and onshore rig environments in various countries. 

Accomplished many proud achievements on past positions and currently expanding competencies through Well Engineering and Production Technology subjects with accredited training meanwhile providing mentoring as an active Society of Petroleum Engineers (SPE) member, whilst expanding and maintaining connections in energy industry.

projects.title: Johnson & Johnson Belgium Geothermal Wells Project
projects.description: A series of open hole and cased hole services targeting Dinantian reservoir performed for Janssen Pharmaceutica geothermal project in Belgium campus under Erdwerk GmbH contract, including TLC operations, and successfully reducing carbon footprint at the end of project. Driven by Johnson & Johnson's pledge to reduce carbon emissions by 20 % by 2020, Janssen became the first industrial developer of a geothermal project in Belgium.

contributors.headline: Consultant Drilling Supervisor at Eavor GmbH
Drilling Engineer at Stadtwerke München GmbH
SLB Deployment Manager | Operations Systems, Digital Transformation & Change Management | Sales & Operations Management | Field Operations

projects.title: First Seismic Wireline Operations on Fatih Drillship
projects.description: First seismic VSP operations successfully performed for Fatih Drillship owned by Turkish Petroleum, on deep sea drilling Alanya-1 well. A prominent service delivery for Turkish Petroleum exploration activities on mediterranean and SLB contractual binding agreements, the operation solidified North Sea standards could be achieved for future operations on TP deep sea activities.

projects.title: PbS Golden Award Participant
projects.description: PNX Pulsar logging performed outstandingly for Shell / NAM with collaboration of remote operations, domain champions and SIS data services connected distantly, resulting in a client recognition and participation for PbS (Performed by Schlumberger) Golden Awarded subject. Complex lithology specifications mixed with feldspar and clay, acquired successfully within a gas environment small diameter well, a crucial formation evaluation data in cased hole conditions. Further tool response and acquisition techniques analyzed and implemented by product owners and InTouch engineers for further development of PNX capabilities.

projects.title: First SLB Wireline Remote Operations in North Sea
projects.description: First remote supported wireline operations in the North Sea performed for Wintershall, in a challenging heavy mud environment as finalizing run for a series of cased hole services on Andalusite North D12-A4. Following the operations, a dedicated connection route for SLB wireline has been installed on the Maersk Resolve & Maersk Resolute rigs, and advancing the opportunity for future real-time remote data acquisition and interpretation.

projects.title: Petroleum Engineering Design II – Reservoir Management & Evaluation for an Injection Field
projects.description: As a sequel for another design project; evaluation of the field & geographic structure by means of assets and management phases of the reservoir in a technical perspective, are being conducted with a team of 5 members. Main topics of this project include; Reserve Estimations (volumetric & probabilistic), Decline Curve Analysis & Forecasting, Well Test Analysis, Gas Injection Planning, Reservoir Simulation, Economic Analysis (through oil price scenarios).

contributors.headline: Shell şirketinde Maintenance and Investments Manager
Project Sales Engineer at RM Gaz Kontrol Sistemleri

projects.title: Deep and Ultra-Deep Water Offshore Production Systems
projects.description: This project is based on extensive academic survey of deep and ultra deep offshore oil production systems and modeling study of an existing ultra deep offshore oil production field. In the first stage; deep and ultra-deep water fields in the world and description of applied production systems, alternative methods for producing from deep and ultra-deep water oil and gas fields, identification and description of production equipment (wellbore, sub-sea and surface) used for deep water offshore systems, safety and environmental issues and precautions for deep and ultra-deep water systems and flow assurance problems and solutions are analyzed through an extensive literature survey. In the second stage; network modeling of 1st module 2nd phase of the Roncador field at Campos basin  with PIPESIM software is done and analyzed by gathering and using field data published in the literature.

contributors.headline: Procurement Engineer at EGE GAZ A.Ş.

projects.title: Petroleum Engineering Design I – Well Drilling Design in an Injection Field
projects.description: In this design project; strategic, technical and economic planning of a well to be drilled is conducted with a 5 member team. Main titles of this design project include; location selection through pre-existing geological data, technical design of the casings, bits, and the drill string, design and planning of the drilling fluids, cementing operation and hydraulics, selection and the planning of the rig and the power systems, HSE planning and operational cost estimation.

contributors.headline: Shell şirketinde Maintenance and Investments Manager
Project Sales Engineer at RM Gaz Kontrol Sistemleri

profile_positions.description:
- Building and maintaining network within energy sector, sharing industry insights and practical career advice with young professionals, providing support with academic and career direction within SPE resources 
- Expanding competencies through Production Engineering (tubing design, P&A operations, acidizing treatments, workover operations, production surveillance, artificial lift design), Reservoir Engineering (core analysis, reservoir characterization, log analysis, PVT analysis, recovery estimate), and Drilling Engineering (well control, developing casing program, mud design and selection, directional drilling, solids control, cementing program) within SPE Competency Management Tool (IHRDC Competency Management) framework and engineering matrices
profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description:
- Providing solutions for many major offshore / energy companies present in Netherlands including: Fugro, Technip, Marin Sampling Holland, ONE-Peterson, Ardent Maritime, Kistos, SeaMar (Alaborg)
- Building network with offshore companies, establishing customer contact for logistics solutions
- Remote tracking and optimize resource utilization, developing future estimate analysis from historical data
- Reviewing and advising material and personnel logistics practices including HazMat handling
- Business reporting periodically, communicating weekly and monthly planning of business solutions within business systems framework, and compiling outcomes to be compatible with VBA (Visual Basic for Applications)
profile_positions.title: Optimization Engineer & Operations Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Supervising well logging and well intervention operations, with wireline conveyance and tools including latest tractor (UltraTRAC, TuffTRAC, MaxTRAC) conveyance technologies. Also perform DSL well logging, as well as CTC (Coiled Tubing Conveyance), TCP (Tubing Conveyed Perforating) operations and TLC (Tough Logging Conditions) drill pipe conveyance
- Tracking maintenance, designing operations, and delivering field service of tools acquiring logs of cased hole production wells (PS Platform, PLT, RST / PNX, SCMT, HFND, memory PLT) as well as flow assurance well intervention (HSD perforation, CPST explosive & MPBT mechanical plugs, DBA cement bailing, addressable switch perforating, explosive punchers), open hole condition wells (acoustic, resistivity, sonic scanning, well imaging - FMI, OBMI, HGNS, HNGS, AIT, CMR, VSI Seismic, Coring - XL Rock, MSCT), and well integrity services (USIT – IBC, PMIT, EMIT, sonic CBL - VDL)
- On-site interpretation of well log outputs for remote locations and operations continuity, client advisory meetings on service requirements, service delivery and preparation for Europe geomarket countries including Netherlands, United Kingdom, Germany, Denmark, France, Belgium, Romania and Turkey
- Quality assurance and control of log deliverables on-site and after operations, perform equipment maintenance within reliability centered maintenance (RCM) framework, assigning field units and cables for various well conditions on both offshore and onshore environments, pressure control equipment operations specialization
- Ensuring QHSE and business process compliance with monitoring QUEST records, financial and business tracking of billing and invoicing through internal company business systems, regularly reporting service delivery end results, competency training personnel on both technical and safety subjects
profile_positions.title: Wireline Field Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Job design and planning introduction, providing wireline service for natural gas and geothermal wells, preparing service packages and mobilization for various countries, dangerous goods (explosive and neutron - gamma ray nuclear sources) handling and transportation, remote assisted field operations for competency adherence
- Practice with the use of business systems for both internal & external company communications, offshore certifications training, preparing country and continent specific safety documents per mobilization
profile_positions.title: Wireline Field Engineer

profile_positions.description: - Extensive training on wireline segment in technical and business aspects, theoretical and practical education of wireline technologies, field operations mainly focused on cased hole wireline engineering, introductory applications to open hole operations, interpretation fundamentals, and digital slickline advancements
